entry.title: " Denver spends between $42,000 and $104,000 each year per...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

" Denver spends between $42,000 and $104,000 each year per person experiencing homelessness...

Rental housing groups estimate the average annual rent for a one-bedroom unit is about $20,000."
---------------------
too easy to fix the money is already there and already Being spent....
Assuming this report is accurate.

https://www.denverpost.com/…/homeless-denver-spending-metr…/

See MoreDenver spends between $42,000 and $104,000 each year per person experiencing homelessness, according to a new report from University of Colorado Denver and Common Sense Institute.

denverpost.com

Report: Denver’s annual per-person spending on homeless is twice the cost of a 1-bedroom apartment

Denver spends between $42,000 and $104,000 each year per person experiencing homelessness, according to a new report from University of Colorado Denver and Common Sense Institute.Denver spends between $42,000 and $104,000 each year per person experiencing homelessness, according to a new report from University of Colorado Denver and Common Sense Institute.

entry.title: We got this email from someone the other day and they agreed to...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

We got this email from someone the other day and they agreed to share it publicly.

"I need some help.. my property was taken from Platte river by the parks and recreation.. all off my clothes toiletries, and my wallet.. with my id, birth cert, SS card, and my debit cards were in my suitcase.. it was a new Samsonite rolling black bag.. that would not be mistaken for trash at all.. I have been to the storage unit downtown and there was nothing there but a few garbage cans tha...t had some woman's name on them and they were from March or may.. idk who to turn to.. I've tried to call everyone, only to be transferred to the next person, and the next. Not having any form of id has made it impossible to do anything.. I need to know where my things are.. I'm so ready to give up on life.. this is the worst.. why won't anyone help me? I wasn't homeless til I got stuck here.."

She latter replied to our reply with more stories of her experience with homelessness in Denver.

"I was a flight attendant, never been or planned on being homeless.. but I feel like I just did 45 days in hell.. not only did i feel horrible about the situation I was in, I could feel the way the people looked at me.. it is $12 for a shower at TA.. which requires transportation and money and I didn't have either.. when I got my SSDI checkI paid $80 for a room at the Howard Johnson and went thru hell trying to get there.. i needed a shower, some sleep, some air conditioner.... When I tried to check in the owner said he couldn't take my virtual debit card.. even tho I had paid for the room online already.. he also decided I had to have $100 deposit and then he wouldn't use the id I had on my phone..he said he would cancel the reservation for me.. But he didn't.. he reported me as a no show and kept my money.. I have been to the same hotel, booked online without a glitch. No deposit.. No questions asked.. It's things like that.. and the embarrassment of asking for a key to use the bathroom, and having to put up with smart asses.. I quickly got too embarrassed of myself and my situation..I lost hope..

I am so sorry for the delay... I'm back in XX(redacted place)! I finally got tf out of that hellish existence.. omg . It's not ok to treat people like that.. we are supposed to do into others as we would do unto ourselves.. not make the unfortunate feel worse about their mere existence.... But I've seen it from both sides.. never thought I would be able to say that.. and. Oh my lord!"

See More

entry.title: hmmm that's interesting... " A lawyer in Portland,...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

hmmm that's interesting...

" A lawyer in Portland, Oregon, suspected that a city contractor was illegally trashing property belonging to people living at an encampment for people experiencing homelessness, so he covertly attached Apple AirTag tracking devices to some of the items. Sure enough, the items ended up in a landfill, and now there may be enough legal evidence to stop the city from sweeping these camps indefinitely."
-----------------------
the same indiscriminate t...echniques of trashing peoples personal property is used by contractors hired here in Denver as well. At this point all we have done to track it is video recordings.

But we do know this from a report we released a few weeks ago.

"Less than one-ﬁfth (19.7%) of respondents had gone to city storage [to recover property from sweeps] Of that small group of respondents who were able to visit the storage facility, the majority (53.8%) were unable to recover any property. 26.9% were able to recover some of their property, and only 19.2% of those who visited the storage facility reported being able to recover all of their belongings " from "Swept to No Where" just released a few weeks ago. You can find it on this link on our website. below

https://denverhomelessoutloud.org/swept-to-nowhere/

https://gizmodo.com/apple-airtags-used-to-prove-that-contra…

See MoreScary and invasive tracking, but make it morally conscious... or something like that.

gizmodo.com

Apple Airtags Used to Prove That Contractor Illegally Trashed Unhoused People's Property

Scary and invasive tracking, but make it morally conscious... or something like that.Scary and invasive tracking, but make it morally conscious... or something like that.

entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

"Biden said he pushed the CDC to again consider its options. But he still seemed hesitant as to whether the new moratorium could withstand lawsuits about its constitutionality, saying he has sought the opinions of experts as to whether the Supreme Court would approve the measure."

“The bulk of the constitutional scholarship says that it’s not likely to pass constitutional muster,” Biden said. “But there are several key scholars who think that it may and it’s worth the effort....

entry.title: Not that federal politician's would ever let themselves be...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Not that federal politician's would ever let themselves be
bought out by corporate entities. No wonder they were in such a rush to go home and avoid dealing with the crisis.

"House Democrats’ super PAC took in a million dollars from
the chairman of a massive apartment rental company in June,...
before letting the federal eviction moratorium expire
over the weekend amid a COVID-19 pandemic that continues to surge."

See MoreDemocrats received a million dollars from a real estate mogul just before failing in their “relentless campaign” to extend a lifeline to struggling renters.

dailyposter.com

Dems Scored Real Estate Cash Before Letting Eviction Ban Expire

entry.title: SWEEPS week of 8/2-8/6/21 SWEEPS next week are on Tuesday 8/3 at...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

SWEEPS week of 8/2-8/6/21
SWEEPS next week are on Tuesday 8/3 at 29th Street, Delgany Street, and Denargo Street (including 29th Street between Arkins Court and Delgany Street)and Wednesday 8/4 at W. Asbury Avenue, S. Bannock Street, W. Warren Avenue, and Santa Fe Drive and on Thursday 8/5 at W. Evans Avenue, S. Santa Fe Drive, W. Harvard Avenue, and S. Platte River Drive.
The SWEEPS will begin each day at 5 a.m.
Please bring the following things to assist residents:

...

-Truck, or any vehicle to help move
-Carts
-Bungee Cords
-Rope
-Trash Bags
-Food
-Coffee/CoCo
-Water
Please come and support our unhoused community members as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive.
Your advocacy is much appreciated!
Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…

See More

entry.title: SWEEPS update week of 7/26-7/30/21 SWEEPS this week began on...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

SWEEPS update week of 7/26-7/30/21
SWEEPS this week began on Tuesday 7/27 at 16th and Marion. Approximately 20 people were traumatically displaced. While that displacement was occurring, DPD district 2 was enforcing the camping ban at a nearby camp at 26th and Larimer. One officer refused to give their contact information to DHOL. It was determined that this was Officer Steven Hammack #13103. DHOL requested a phone call from District 2 Sargeant, but never received one.
SWEEPS... continued in the same area on Wednesday 7/28. According to DOTI, the entire grid (16th to 20th to park/ Clarkson to Lafayette) was posted and that they would go street to street removing people. DHOL could find no evidence of posting throughout this grid. Approximately 8 people were traumatically displaced.
SWEEPS this week concluded on Thurs 7/29 at 5th and Bannock outside of Four Winds and the VOA youth and family center. Both Four Winds and VOA were working with the residents, supporting the small camp, and advocated to keep them there with their support. DOTI, EHS, DPD and the Mayor's office traumatically displaced them anyway. Approximately 14 people were forcibly removed. Many of these residents were Lakotas living other ancestral lands with their tiyospaye (family group) in a culturally appropriate way. Land acknowledgements are just words if there is no action to correct behavior. That, is manipulation.
SWEEPS don't solve homelessness! Homelessness ends with housing. Until we can procure enough affordable, safe and accessible housing we need to plan for our unhoused community! It is irresponsible not to! We march onward towards Rights, Dignity, Housing....

entry.title: This is very big news... having run the Right to Rest Act at...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

This is very big news... having run the Right to Rest Act at the state level several times we are familiar with the kind of resistance it will receive.
The press conference starts about 4 min in to the video. Link to the full resolution and a one pager in the comments.

https://www.facebook.com/RepCori/videos/571231847206355

Congresswoman Cori Bush was live.

entry.title: Boulder has for years operated as if it was above the law in...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Boulder has for years operated as if it was above the law in criminalizing homelessness. Today, the ACLU put the city and county on notice that that is not the case.

ACLU of Colorado

Today, we sent a letter to government officials in Boulder, demanding an end to their unconstitutional and inhumane treatment of unhoused Boulder residents. The... letter follows an ACLU investigation that found that unhoused residents are denied shelter due to arbitrary residency requirements and unjustly prosecuted for sleeping outdoors even when they have no adequate alternatives. https://aclu-co.org/aclu-of-colorado-cautions-boulder-stop…/

See More

entry.title: What will we get spending taxpayer money on an entertainment...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

What will we get spending taxpayer money on an entertainment venue? More homelessness. Let the rich builds their own playhouses without tax payer subsidies. One of the most successful venues in town that hosts our basketball and hockey teams was not built with tax payer money. So it is possible.

In light of our current housing crisis this is extremely poor policy.
Many in our homeless community are already employed at these venues receiving low pay and seasonal layoffs...

Continue ReadingDenver Mayor Michael Hancock says if the city council and voters approve his bond proposal, they’ll get a new arena, a public market and more shelter space for the homeless.

denverpost.com

Here’s what Denverites would get out of the mayor’s proposed $450 million bond measure

Denver Mayor Michael Hancock says if the city council and voters approve his bond proposal, they’ll get a new arena, a public market and more shelter space for the homeless.Denver Mayor Michael Hancock says if the city council and voters approve his bond proposal, they’ll get a new arena, a public market and more shelter space for the homeless.

entry.title: "Infrastructure is muti-generational" @12min...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

"Infrastructure is muti-generational" @12min

Instead of housing we built sports stadiums, convention centers , "pavilions" and we are about to do it again. 400 mil for an entertainment center at the national western sports complex, and only 28 million for housing. the 28 million is coming from the feds
200 million of the entertainment center is coming from taxpaying denverites. I think we need to address our housing issue before we build another rich person playground.

...

And don't be fooled by 7500 "jobs" many of our homeless already work at the current low paying sports arena job and are still homeless. This project will only make the housing situation worse.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g5QcUYyaTs0
